insights.populationGrowth: Declining population at -0.8% annually due to outmigration to larger cities. Rural communities particularly affected by youth emigration.
insights.educationLevel: Moderate education levels with 76% literacy. Limited higher education opportunities drive youth to leave for educational purposes.
insights.employmentPattern: Livestock herding 60%, agriculture 15%, government services 10%, small trade 8%, crafts/traditional industries 7%. Strong traditional economy base.
insights.housingPattern: Traditional gers 55%, permanent houses 30%, seasonal shelters 15%. Traditional nomadic lifestyle remains dominant with seasonal mobility patterns.

insights.temperature: Continental steppe climate with harsh winters (-32째C) and hot summers (32째C). Eastern location provides some moderation compared to western regions.
insights.precipitation: Annual precipitation 200-250mm concentrated in summer months. Adequate for grassland but insufficient for intensive agriculture without irrigation.
insights.seasonality: Severe winter (November-March) with high dzud risk, short spring (April-May) with dust storms, warm summer (June-August) with thunderstorms, brief autumn (September-October).
insights.extremeEvents: Frequent dzud events devastating livestock, severe droughts reducing pasture quality, occasional hailstorms damaging crops and grasslands.

vulnerabilities.geographical: Remote southeastern location with extreme continental climate, limited accessibility during disasters
vulnerabilities.infrastructure: Minimal infrastructure development, poor road conditions, limited communication networks
vulnerabilities.social: Aging population due to youth outmigration, traditional lifestyle highly vulnerable to climate extremes
vulnerabilities.economic: Complete dependence on climate-sensitive livestock economy, limited economic diversification options
